channel.title: Beyond the Movement: The Pilates Podcast
channel.description: The First Internet Broadcast for the Pilates Method
channel.copyright: All content Â©2005, thepilatespodcast.com. Please ask for permission before use.
channel.itunes:subtitle: The First Internet Broadcast for the Pilates Method
channel.itunes:summary: Beyond the Movement is the very first Podcast dedicated to the Pilates Method. Your host, Heidi Miller has an extensive fitness background and has dedicated herself to her Pilates studio and her many students. While teaching, Heidi has recognized the need to inform and inspire. She has an intuitive understanding of the mechanics of the body and a passion for helping others to unlock their body's potential. Pilates is based on movement, but after only a few sessions, most people begin to understand that Pilates can be so much more than movement alone. This Podcast is dedicated to providing insight and exploration into the body's awakening as you progress beyond the movement.
channel.itunes:keywords: pilates, yoga, fitness, exercise, movement, teaching, teachers, student, students, lifestyle, health, community
channel.itunes:author: www.thepilatespodcast.com

item.title: Beyond the Movement April 5th, 2009 Episode 042
item.description: Melissa Turnock. Melissa, a pilates teacher from Australia, and Heidi talk about the importance of the pelvic floor muscles in relation to Pilates.
item.itunes:subtitle: Melissa Turnock. Melissa, a pilates teacher from Australia, and Heidi talk about the importance of the pelvic floor muscles in relation to Pilates.
item.itunes:summary:
Melissa Turnock. Melissa, a pilates teacher from Australia, and Heidi talk about the importance of the pelvic floor muscles in relation to Pilates.
Check out Melissa's website at www.pilatesscene.com.
Thanks for listening! If you have any ideas for future interviews please Let Heidi know by sending her an email to heidi@thepilatespodcast.com.

item.title: Beyond the Movement February 21st, 2009 Episode 041
item.description: Heidi's Back! Heidi Miller, owner of Mountain View Pilates in Fort Collins, Colorado talks about balancing motherhood and owning a pilates studio. She also talks about ways to boost morale in trying economic times within your studio.
item.itunes:subtitle: Heidi's Back! Heidi Miller, owner of Mountain View Pilates in Fort Collins, Colorado talks about balancing motherhood and owning a pilates studio. She also talks about ways to boost morale in trying economic times within your studio.
item.itunes:summary:
Heidi's Back! Heidi Miller, owner of Mountain View Pilates in Fort Collins, Colorado talks about balancing motherhood and owning a pilates studio. She also talks about ways to boost morale in trying economic times within your studio.
Thanks for listening! If you have any ideas for future episodes please Let Heidi know by sending her an email to heidi@thepilatespodcast.com.

item.title: Beyond the Movement March 16th, 2008 Episode 040
item.description: Amanda Moon. It's been months but Heidi's back and returning with a great interview of Amanda Moon discussing Pilates and Pregnancy.
item.itunes:subtitle: Amanda Moon. It's been months but Heidi's back and returning with a great interview of Amanda Moon discussing Pilates and Pregnancy.
item.itunes:summary:
Amanda Moon. It's been months but Heidi's back and returning with a great interview of Amanda Moon discussing Pilates and Pregnancy.
Amanda is a Pilates instructor in Nashville, Tennessee and also a new Mom. Her daughter Lilly is now 5 months old and inspired her Mom to specialize in teaching Pilates to pre- and post-natal women.
They talk about the incredible changes a woman's body goes through during and after pregnancy, modifications to the Pilates repertoire.
Heidi is also a new Mom (see her son at www.samueldennismiller.com) and the two discuss their personal experiences of Pilates during pregnancy and the journey of using the Method to get back into shape afterwords.
If you'd like to know more about Amanda, please visit her website at www.pilatesformommies.net.
Thanks for listening! IF you have any ideas for future interviews please Let Heidi know by sending her an email to heidi@thepilatespodcast.com.
item.itunes:keywords: pilates, yoga, fitness, exercise, movement, teaching, teachers, student, students, lifestyle, health, community
item.itunes:author: www.thepilatespodcast.com

item.title: Beyond the Movement October 7th, 2007 Episode 039
item.description: Scoliosis and Pilates. Katy Evertson is an inspiration to not only anyone with any spine condition, but really to all of us.
item.itunes:subtitle: Scoliosis and Pilates. Katy Evertson is an inspiration to not only anyone with any spine condition, but really to all of us.
item.itunes:summary:
Scoliosis and Pilates. Katy Evertson is an inspiration to not only anyone with any spine condition, but really to all of us. How many of us really work to our potential? Katy and I talk about her journey with scoliosis and how Pilates has helped her stay active in sports and activities she enjoys.
Mountain View Pilates is looking for a part-time teacher with full-time potential. Teacher need to have a comprehensive certification on mat and equipment. Go to www.mountainviewpilates.org for contact information if you are interested. You can also email Heidi at heidi@thepilatespodcast with inquiries.
Please consider taking a few minutes to fill out the listener survey on our web site. It's painless, and will help us to discover more about our audience. We have a lot of grand plans for Beyond the Movement in the coming months, and the listener survey is one small step towards seeing those plans fulfilled!
Don't forget to subscribe to this podcast if you haven't yet done so. It's really easy, you can subscribe through iTunes or subscribe through Yahoo! Also, check out the Forum here at thepilatespodcast.com and give us feedback, or just join in this new Pilates community. Thanks for listening!
item.itunes:keywords: pilates, yoga, fitness, exercise, movement, teaching, teachers, student, students, lifestyle, health, community

item.title: Beyond the Movement September 18th, 2007 Episode 038
item.description: Mountain View Pilates. Heidi's back this week with an episode about how she began her Pilates studio.
item.itunes:subtitle: Mountain View Pilates. Heidi's back this week with an episode about how she began her Pilates studio.
item.itunes:summary:
Mountain View Pilates. Heidi's back this week with an episode about how she began her Pilates studio. This episode is full of insight about just what it takes to open your own studio and can be a lot of help for those of you trying to decide it your own studio is in your future.
After listening, consider visiting Heidi's online site for her studio at www.mountainviewpilates.org.

item.title: Beyond the Movement July 8th, 2007 Episode 037
item.description: Sherri Bettz. Sherri is a physical therapist and Pilates teacher in California. This week Heidi and Sherri talk about Pilates and osteoporosis as well as the importance of knowing the limitations of clients experiencing bone loss.
item.itunes:subtitle: Sherri Bettz. Sherri is a physical therapist and Pilates teacher in California. This week Heidi and Sherri talk about Pilates and osteoporosis as well as the importance of knowing the limitations of clients experiencing bone loss.
item.itunes:summary:
Sherri Bettz. Sherri is a physical therapist and Pilates teacher in California. This week Heidi and Sherri talk about Pilates and osteoporosis as well as the importance of knowing the limitations of clients experiencing bone loss.
This is an important topic for all teachers and students to be aware of, especially in students over the age of 50.
For more information on Sherri, please visit her website at www.therapilates.com. She can also be emailed directly at sherri@therapilates.com
Please consider taking a few minutes to fill out the listener survey on our web site. It's painless, and will help us to discover more about our audience. item.title: Beyond the Movement June 3rd, 2007 Episode 036
item.description: Re-Energized. This week Heidi talks about the recent Mary Bowen workshop she attended. As many of you know, Mary is a "Pilates Elder"; one of Joseph Pilates original students.
item.itunes:subtitle: Re-Energized. This week Heidi talks about the recent Mary Bowen workshop she attended. As many of you know, Mary is a "Pilates Elder"; one of Joseph Pilates original students.
item.itunes:summary:
Re-Energized. This week Heidi talks about the recent Mary Bowen workshop she attended. As many of you know, Mary is a "Pilates Elder"; one of Joseph Pilates original students.
Heidi also speaks about the importance of opening your heart to open your creativity.
It's been a long six weeks "off the air" but it's good to be back! Thank you to everyone for their emails and support!

item.itunes:summary:
Spencer Baker. This week Heidi speaks with Pilates teacher Spencer Baker. Spencer is the owner of Spencer Pilates Arts, a pilates studio located in Queens, NY. Heidi and Spencer discuss men and Pilates...where are they?
If you would like more information about Spencer, please visit his website at spencerpilatesarts.com or contact him directly at spencerpilatesarts@mac.com.

item.title: Beyond the Movement April 1st, 2007 Episode 034
item.description: Only the experience matters" These were the words spoken at the yoga workshop hosted by John Deminico that I needed to hear to enhance my teaching of the Pilates Method.
item.itunes:subtitle: Only the experience matters" These were the words spoken at the yoga workshop hosted by John Deminico that I needed to hear to enhance my teaching of the Pilates Method.
item.itunes:summary:
"Only the experience matters" These were the words spoken at the yoga workshop hosted by John Deminico that I needed to hear to enhance my teaching of the Pilates Method.
Due to the preciseness and technique of Pilates our students can potentially miss out on the experience. John and I have a heart felt talk about teaching.
If you would like more information about John, please visit his website at www.newparadigmfitness.com.

item.title: Beyond the Movement March 11th, 2007 Episode 033
item.description: Letting Go. On today's episode, Heidi talks about some new ideas she's been contemplating.
item.itunes:subtitle: Letting Go. On today's episode, Heidi talks about some new ideas she's been contemplating.
item.itunes:summary:
Letting Go. On today's episode, Heidi talks about some new ideas she's been contemplating. She recently attended a yoga workshop and has really been excited with a greater understanding of Joe's original ideas for Pilates. Sometimes trying new things can be difficult, but they can also lead to being a better teacher when you simply learn to let go of your preconceptions. This is a great episode for both students and teachers.

item.title: Beyond the Movement October 29th, 2006 Episode 027
item.description: Uncork Your Potential. Heidi's back and in this week's episode explains how her recent experience with Pilates Elder Mary Bowen taught her to release the mind and find the spine.
item.itunes:subtitle: Uncork Your Potential. Heidi's back and in this week's episode explains how her recent experience with Pilates Elder Mary Bowen taught her to release the mind and find the spine.
item.itunes:summary:
Uncork Your Potential. Heidi's back and in this week's episode explains how her recent experience with Pilates Elder Mary Bowen taught her to release the mind and find the spine. Can this uncork the potential to our true selves? Listen and find out--this episode really goes 'beyond the movement'!
If you would like more information about Mary Bowen consider listening to episode 15 or go to www.pilates-marybowen.com.

item.itunes:summary:
Pilates and Spirituality. On this week's episode Heidi considers the spiritual side of the Pilates Method. Sometimes, new clients come to Pilates after finding that yoga was not a good fit for their belief system. Heidi discusses how Pilates can fit into most people's worldview.

item.title: Beyond the Movement September 10th, 2006 Episode 025
item.description: Lee Cooper. On this week's episode Heidi interviews ballet and modern dance instructor Lee Cooper.
item.itunes:subtitle: Lee Cooper. On this week's episode Heidi interviews ballet and modern dance instructor Lee Cooper.
item.itunes:summary:
Lee Cooper. On this week's episode Heidi interviews ballet and modern dance instructor Lee Cooper. Lee is in the process of becoming a certified Pilates instructor and is interested in the concepts of Pilates and how they can benefit her dancing and her dance instruction. Many students come to Pilates from a dance background so this is an interview you should not miss!
If you would like to know more about Lee, she can be emailed at leecooper5@comcast.net

item.title: Beyond the Movement August 27th, 2006 Episode 024
item.description: It's All About Balance. On this week's episode Heidi shares some exciting news, and how it's throwing everything a little bit off kilter. We wouldn't have it any other way.
item.itunes:subtitle: It's All About Balance. On this week's episode Heidi shares some exciting news, and how it's throwing everything a little bit off kilter. We wouldn't have it any other way.
item.itunes:summary:
It's All About Balance. On this week's episode Heidi shares some exciting news, and how it's throwing everything a little bit off kilter. We wouldn't have it any other way.
Pilates is about balance of the body, mind and spirit. All three can act independently and it can be quite a challenge to get them into a harmonious state. Heidi is in the midst of finding that balance and shares her struggles and successes.

item.title: Beyond the Movement August 13th, 2006 Episode 023
item.description: Eme Cole. On this week's episode Heidi interviews Pilates instructor and author Eme Cole.
item.itunes:subtitle: Eme Cole. On this week's episode Heidi interviews Pilates instructor and author Eme Cole.
item.itunes:summary:
Eme Cole. On this week's episode Heidi interviews Pilates instructor and author Eme Cole. Eme owns and teaches at her own studio in Chicago, Illinois and has worked very hard to compile much of the Pilates exercises into a series of manuals. The 5 manuals frame over 1400 pictures and give cuing that is neutral in description, to inspire instructors from all different backgrounds. Think of her manuals as an "encyclopedia of exercises." It is a very interesting project and she's asking for your help to make the manuals even better!
If you'd like to know more about Eme's project, she invites you to call her at (773) 682-3020 or simply log on to thepilatesmovement.com.
Please consider taking a few minutes to fill out the listener survey on our web site. It's painless, and will help us to discover more about our audience. We have a lot of grand plans for Beyond the Movement in the coming months, and the listener survey is one small step towards seeing those plans fulfilled!

item.title: Beyond the Movement August 6th, 2006 Episode 022
item.description: Just a Teaser. This week's episode really isn't an episode. Just wanted everyone to know that we're still here. It's been a wonderful summer--busy as can be--and Heidi had to take a few weeks off to take care of business.
item.itunes:subtitle: Just a Teaser. This week's episode really isn't an episode. Just wanted everyone to know that we're still here. It's been a wonderful summer--busy as can be--and Heidi had to take a few weeks off to take care of business.
item.itunes:summary:
Just a Teaser. This week's episode really isn't an episode. Just wanted everyone to know that we're still here. It's been a wonderful summer--busy as can be--and Heidi had to take a few weeks off to take care of business. Of course, the little trip to the family cottage on the coast of Maine was nice, too! So, thanks to everyone for their continued support and hang in there! We'll be back to our regular schedule in the next week or two.
Please consider taking a few minutes to fill out the listener survey on our web site. It's painless, and will help us to discover more about our audience. We have a lot of grand plans for Beyond the Movement in the coming months, and the listener survey is one small step towards seeing those plans fulfilled!

item.title: Beyond the Movement July 9th, 2006 Episode 021
item.description: Regina May De Los Reyes. This week Heidi conducts her first international interview with Filipino Pilates instructor Regina May De Los Reyes.
item.itunes:subtitle: Regina May De Los Reyes. This week Heidi conducts her first international interview with Filipino Pilates instructor Regina May De Los Reyes.
item.itunes:summary:
Regina May De Los Reyes. This week Heidi conducts her first international interview with Filipino Pilates instructor Regina May De Los Reyes. Regina received her Stott Pilates certification in San Diego, California and currently teaches in Manila.
A universal story we all share as Pilates teachers around the world: Pilates is changing lives! As students and teachers we are noticing something about Pilates that is different than just walking on the treadmill. It spills over into our daily lives. The focus, the discipline, the quiet of the mind and we are learning how to just be more of who we are.
If you would like to know more about Regina please visit her through her excellent blog at http://dancepilatesqueen.blogspot.com and by email at dancepilatesqueen@yahoo.com
If you are a Pilates instructor in need of Pilates Method Alliance approved continuing education credits, consider joining Heidi at her studio this Summer. Mountain View Pilates in Fort Collins, Colorado will be hosting a workshop with Wendy LeBlanc-Arbuckle August 5th and 6th, 2006. Call Heidi at her studio for all the details: (970) 207-1797. Click here for more information.

item.itunes:subtitle: "A Butterfly of a Different Color". This week Heidi speaks from her heart about body image and how Pilates is helping to heal some old wounds.
item.itunes:summary:
"A Butterfly of a Different Color". This week Heidi speaks from her heart about body image and how Pilates is helping to heal some old wounds. In this episode, Heidi mentions her discovery of Reiki. Reiki is a form of spiritual healing that is based on the concept and belief of "life force energy". The episode is not about Reiki, but we wanted to mention it here in case listeners have not heard of it before. Feel free to email Heidi if you have any questions.

item.itunes:summary:
Liz Ikard-Magalong. In this episode Heidi continues the conversation on classical vs. contemporary teachings of the Pilates Method. She speaks with Liz, who was one of her first Pilates instructors. Liz teaches at two separate studios, one which teaches the strictly classical Method and one which is highly evolved into the teachings of contemporary Pilates.

item.title: Beyond the Movement April 16th, 2006 Episode 015
item.description: Elder Mary Bowen. In this episode Heidi speaks with teacher Mary Bowen, a Jungian Psychoanalyst and one of the 5 remaining Pilates teachers who studied with Joe and Clara Pilates.
item.itunes:subtitle: Elder Mary Bowen. In this episode Heidi speaks with teacher Mary Bowen, a Jungian Psychoanalyst and one of the 5 remaining Pilates teachers who studied with Joe and Clara Pilates.
item.itunes:summary:
Elder Mary Bowen. In this episode Heidi speaks with teacher Mary Bowen, a Jungian Psychoanalyst and one of the 5 remaining Pilates teachers who studied with Joe and Clara Pilates. Mary has been a student of Pilates since 1959 and continues to take at least one private lesson every week. Heidi speaks with Mary about the continual process of learning Pilates and how Pilates has evolved since Joe began to pass on his Method.
This is an episode Pilates enthusiasts will want to listen to many times!
If you'd like more information about Mary or would like to contact her, please visit her website at www.pilates-marybowen.com.

item.itunes:summary:
Michael Arbuckle. In this episode Heidi speaks with influential equipment designer and Peak Pilates co-founder Michael Arbuckle. The two discuss the subtleties of the Pilates equipment and how the classical exercises have integrated with contemporary design. item.itunes:subtitle: Bodywork and Pilates. In this episode, Heidi is joined by massage therapist Van Wetzig.
item.itunes:summary:
Bodywork and Pilates. We continue our exploration into the depth of the mind/body connection of the Pilates Method. In this episode, Heidi is joined by massage therapist Van Wetzig for a discussion on life's distractions and the stress it puts on the body. Also, how bodywork and Pilates bring our awareness closer to our natural state, therefore enabling us to make better life choices.
If you'd like to know more about Van and his practice he extends the invitation to call (970) 231-1214.

Wendy LeBlanc-Arbuckle. We continue our exploration into the depth of the mind/body connection of the Pilates Method. In this episode, Heidi is joined by Pilates teacher Wendy LeBlanc-Arbuckle from the Pilates Center of Austin in Austin, Texas. Wendy is an internationally known "teacher of teachers," and this is an interview no one will want to miss!

item.title: Beyond the Movement February 19th, 2006 Episode 010
item.description: The Healing Power of Movement. We continue our exploration into the depth of the mind/body connection. Heidi discusses the Pilates equipment as a way to release tension and emotional guarding in the body.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Healing Power of Movement. We continue our exploration into the depth of the mind/body connection. Heidi discusses the Pilates equipment as a way to release tension and emotional guarding in the body.
item.itunes:summary:
The Healing Power of Movement. We continue our exploration into the depth of the mind/body connection. Heidi discusses the Pilates equipment as a way to release tension and emotional guarding in the body.
Also, a Pilates routine can sometimes feel like a dance with the equipment as your partner. The journey to get to this dance shows the power of movement in the healing process.
The response to Beyond the Movement has been overwhelming. We'd like to shout out a big Thank You to all the listeners for staying subscribed. We're especially thankful for those of you who have taken the time to support us with your donations. We don't even know what to say...

item.itunes:summary:
Another perspective. In this episode, Heidi interviews Pilates teacher, lecturer and author Gary Calderone. Gary has been teaching the Pilates Method for 15 years and has a great deal to say about how Pilates can improve more than just your body, but can improve your life. This is a conversation that both students and teachers will not want to miss!
If you'd like to know more about Gary and his philosophical view on Joseph Pilates' Contology, please visit his website at www.pilateswithcalderone.com.

item.title: Beyond the Movement December 25th, 2005 Episode 003
item.description: Take some time and clear your mind. This episode is about creating a greater awareness of self. For many of us, it's not the easiest thing to make time for, but it's one of the underlying concepts of the Pilates Method. Heidi gives listeners a short excercise to try and explains the importance of imagery. These are powerful teaching tools that can accelerate your ability to move through your body...and increase your awareness of self!

item.title: Beyond the Movement: The Pilates Podcast
item.description: The first Internet Broadcast for the Pilates Method
item.itunes:subtitle: Our very first show! Meet your host Heidi Miller and get a feel for just what this Podcast will be all about.
item.itunes:summary:
Our very first show! Meet your host Heidi Miller and get a feel for just what this Podcast will be all about.
In this show, Heidi talks about the Forum here at ThePilatesPodcast.com, and how you can contact her. If you're interested in Pilates and moving to the next level, you need to listen to this show! Don't forget to subscribe to Beyond the Movement using iTunes or Yahoo. It's easy, and best of all it's free.
